#Text=300 protesters greet Farage 's return to Edinburgh
#Text=Saturday , May 10 , 2014
#Text=Video from the anti- UKIP protest on Friday
#Text=Image : Brian McNeil .

#Text=Roughly 300 protesters turned up yesterday for the return of Nigel Farage , leader of the UK Independence Party , to Edinburgh after last year 's disastrous attempt at a press conference in a pub at the foot of The Canongate .
#Text=Unseen by protesters or public , Farage is believed to have left the venue around 7:30pm .

#Text=Farage 's last visit saw protesters leaving him barracked in the bar by police , with several taxis refusing to take the party leader and Member of the European Parliament ( MEP ) for South East England to the airport .
#Text=Protest against UKIP outside the Edinburgh Corn Exchange
#Text=Image : Brian McNeil .
#Text=Given the hostile reception on his last visit , far-right group Britain First garnered publicity earlier in the week with an apparent offer of " armoured vehicles " for Farage 's visit .
#Text=However , no support from ex- BNP councillor Paul Golding 's political party , or the offered armoured vehicles , were in-evidence .

#Text=Despite attempts to keep the location secret , the Radical Independence Campaign began calling for protesters to turn up on Friday , at the city 's Corn Exchange , nearly a week before the event .
#Text=Farage was already believed to be inside the building when Wikinews arrived shortly after 4:30pm .
#Text=At that time , five satellite trucks were present and New Market Road , running past the venue , was still open to traffic .
#Text=Protesters against UKIP in Edinburgh yesterday .
#Text=Image : Brian McNeil .
#Text=An elderly , and near-solitary , UKIP supporter waving the Scottish Flag
#Text=Image : Brian McNeil .
#Text=Protesters blocking the entrance to the Corn Exchange
#Text=Image : Brian McNeil .
#Text=Police Scotland had a high-visibility presence at the protest
#Text=Image : Brian McNeil .
#Text=The anti- UKIP protest was , largely , good-natured Image : Brian McNeil .
#Text=Protesters blocking the entrance to the Corn Exchange
#Text=Image : Brian McNeil .
#Text=Perhaps unaware of the irony in his wardrobe choice , one of the few visible UKIP supporters sported a baseball cap advertising Croatia , who joined the EU less than a year ago
#Text=Image : Brian McNeil .
#Text=One protester turned up in the V mask favoured by Anonymous
#Text=Image : Brian McNeil .
#Text=Protesters blocking the entrance to the Corn Exchange
#Text=Image : Brian McNeil .
#Text=One unlucky couple discovered they 'd picked the same date , and venue , for their wedding celebration
#Text=Image : Brian McNeil .
#Text=UKIP supporters outside the Corn Exchange were significantly outnumbered by press and photographers
#Text=Image : Brian McNeil .
#Text=/
#Text=Protesters blocking the entrance to the Corn Exchange
#Text=Image : Brian McNeil .
#Text=A significant number of banners and placards on-display were home-made
#Text=Image : Brian McNeil .
#Text=Socialist Worker placards accused UKIP of spreading racist lies
#Text=Image : Brian McNeil .
#Text=UKIP supporters outside the Corn Exchange were significantly outnumbered by press and photographers
#Text=Image :
#Text=Brian McNeil .
#Text=UKIP 's perceived racism was one of the targets of banners and placards
#Text=Image : Brian McNeil .
#Text=One protester brought a patchwork quilt , embroidered with " Scotland against racist fascist bigots " Image : Brian McNeil .
#Text=Amongst those keeping an eve on events , local Labour councillor Nick Gardner ( centre-left )
#Text=Image : Brian McNeil .
#Text=One of five satellite trucks at the event ( foreground )
#Text=Image : Brian McNeil .
#Text=Several speakers addressed the crowd from a ' scrum ' immediately in-front of the building
#Text=Image : Brian McNeil .
#Text=Protesters began arriving en-masse closer to 5:30pm , with numbers peaking around an hour later .

#Text=Police vans were moved to block the road ; although , traffic to the venue was still being permitted for a wedding party with the misfortune to pick the same date as Farage 's only visit to Scotland during the current European Parliament election campaign .
#Text=Several speakers addressed the crowd protesting against UKIP being in Scotland , with the actual number of UKIP attendees inside , to hear Farage speak , estimated at around 50 .

#Text=One speaker , a schoolteacher , challenged the mainstream media 's acceptance of UKIP 's assertion the party is not racist , stating her primary school pupils were more-capable of identifying racism and would be pointing its presence out within UKIP were they present .
#Text=Although loud , the protest passed peacefully .
#Text=Chants directed at UKIP included " Whose streets ? Our streets !

#Text=Other taunts called UKIP  scum " , urged people to " smash the SDL " ( Scottish Defence League ) , and clearly labelled UKIP and its supporters as racist .
